title: Hollywood Costume. Inside the wardrobe: panel discussion
other_title: Character, collaboration and the Art of dressing for the screen.
subject_group: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Costume design - Motion pictures
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Costume design
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Costume designers
Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV/Motion pictures, Australian
abstract: Three of Australia's most accomplished cosutme designers discuss their careers.
description: This panel discussion explores the collaborative process between film director and costume designer, the link between costume and character and how costumes connect audiences with on-screen worlds. It also focuses on the artistic role of costuming in the filmmaking process.  Hear from leaders in costuming, film and fashion, the influential Australian film and television costumers Edie Kurzer ('South Solitary', 'Look Both Ways', 'Matching Jack') Cappi Ireland ('I Frankenstein', 'Animal Kingdom', 'The Slap') and Anna Borghesi ('Mao's Last Dancer', 'Ned Kelly' ,'Romper Stomper') in a discussion chaired by NIDA's Head of Costume, Fiona Reilly.
